لم تنساب الكلمات من أصابعه خلال الأسابيع القليلة الماضية. لم يتخيل أبدًا أنه سيجد نفسه مع كتلة الكاتب ، لكن هنا جلس أمامه شاشة فارغة. تلك الشاشة الفارغة التي كانت تسخر منه يومًا بعد يوم بدأت تلعب بعقله. لم يفهم لماذا لم يستطع حتى كتابة كلمة واحدة ، فقط واحدة لبدء العملية والبناء من هناك. ومع ذلك ، كان يعلم بالفعل أن الساعات الثماني التي كان مستعدًا للجلوس فيها أمام جهاز الكمبيوتر الخاص به اليوم ستنتهي مع بقاء الشاشة فارغة. ما كان وراء المنعطف في الدفق غير معروف. كان كلاهما فضوليًا ، لكن واحدًا فقط كان شجاعًا بما يكفي ليريد الاستكشاف. كانت تلك هي المشكلة. كان هناك دائمًا شخص يدع الخوف يسيطر على حياتها. أحيانًا تكون أول لحظة في اليوم تفاجئك. هذا ما كان يفكر فيه ويندي. فتحت نافذتها لترى سيارات الإطفاء وهي تصرخ في الشارع. على الرغم من أن هذا لم يكن شيئًا غير مسموع به تمامًا ، إلا أنه لم يكن طبيعيًا أيضًا. لقد كانت علامة أكيدة على ما سيحدث في ذلك اليوم. كانت تشعر به في عظامها ولم تكن هذه هي الطريقة التي أرادت أن يبدأ بها اليوم. التقط الطرف المحترق من الفرع ووضع علامة على الحجر. اليوم 52 إذا كانت العلامات على الحجر دقيقة. لا يمكن أن يكون متأكدا. بدأ النهار والليالي يمتزجان معًا مما تسبب في حدوث ارتباك ، لكنه كان يعلم أن الوقت قد مضى وقتًا طويلاً. طويل جدا. لا يوجد سوى ثلاث طرق لجعل هذا العمل. الأول هو السماح لي بالاعتناء بكل شيء. والثاني هو أن تعتني بكل شيء. والثالث هو تقسيم كل شيء بنسبة 50/50. أعتقد أن الخيار الأخير هو الأفضل ، لكنني متأكد من أنه سيعني أيضًا نهاية زواجنا.لم تنساب الكلمات من أصابعه خلال الأسابيع القليلة الماضية. لم يتخيل أبدًا أنه سيجد نفسه مع كتلة الكاتب ، لكن هنا جلس أمامه شاشة فارغة. تلك الشاشة الفارغة التي كانت تسخر منه يومًا بعد يوم بدأت تلعب بعقله. لم يفهم لماذا لم يستطع حتى كتابة كلمة واحدة ، فقط واحدة لبدء العملية والبناء من هناك. ومع ذلك ، كان يعلم بالفعل أن الساعات الثماني التي كان مستعدًا للجلوس فيها أمام جهاز الكمبيوتر الخاص به اليوم ستنتهي مع بقاء الشاشة فارغة. ما كان وراء المنعطف في الدفق غير معروف. كان كلاهما فضوليًا ، لكن واحدًا فقط كان شجاعًا بما يكفي ليريد الاستكشاف. كانت تلك هي المشكلة. كان هناك دائمًا شخص يدع الخوف يسيطر على حياتها. أحيانًا تكون أول لحظة في اليوم تفاجئك. هذا ما كان يفكر فيه ويندي. فتحت نافذتها لترى سيارات الإطفاء وهي تصرخ في الشارع. على الرغم من أن هذا لم يكن شيئًا غير مسموع به تمامًا ، إلا أنه لم يكن طبيعيًا أيضًا. لقد كانت علامة أكيدة على ما سيحدث في ذلك اليوم. كانت تشعر به في عظامها ولم تكن هذه هي الطريقة التي أرادت أن يبدأ بها اليوم. التقط الطرف المحترق من الفرع ووضع علامة على الحجر. You've completely misunderstood what you are seeing.  These are not evidence of a common ancestor.  What you are seeing is a common design.  The evidence points to a common Designer, the Lord Almighty, Maker of Heaven and Earth.  All these different life forms were formed by His hands, guided by His purposes, through His agency, and He breathed life into each of them.  His name is Jesus.  If what you are saying was true, that these all came from a common ancestor, then where are the transitional types between the monkey and the narwhale?  There aren't any.  They never existed.  Each type is distinct and separate from the other types.  There are no crossover types.  No trans types.  If you sort all of the life forms into venn diagrams, there aren't any crossovers.  Each type is either within a group, or not within it.  No creature will be seen to crossover from one group to another group.  No in-betweens.
clear and concise tnx
I read an article and understood, but this had something extra. EXAMPLES! Thanks so much!

Thank you sir. One question though, homologous features are evidence of common ancestry - but in order to know if features are homologous or not, we must first know if they came from a common ancestor. Am I missing something here or does that not make sense? It seems almost like circular logic.
1:53 is not 2 minutes
You're welcome!

Thanks for your thoughts.  Are you implying that you do not think The Designer, The Lord Almighty, and The Maker of Heaven and Earth is capable of coming up with and implementing a system like evolution for his creatures? Please answer this question.  Because the evidence to this point is clear that evolution exists. You won't find a transition species between the Narwhale and the Monkey because eon did not transition into the other. Rather they both evolved from an earlier common ancestor.   There is no deep dark plot here. Science constantly seeks to disprove scientific theories. This is how the scientific method works. So to this point science has only been able to find results that strengthen or adapt the theory of evolution.  If you have evidence that you can replicate that disproves evolution then there is a Nobel prize waiting for you with future generations to know and applaud your name.

@2MC  What I am saying sir, is that if the Lord did come up with and implement a system like evolution, there would be evidence seen of that.  There would be 'in-between' creatures along the path from the common ancestor to the modern form.  But, there aren't any.  There aren't any 'missing link' fossils, despite 150 years of searching for them.  There are profound discontinuities, missing bridges, if you will, common to all types throughout the entire living kingdom.  There are similarities, yes, but still in all, vast distances at the level of molecular biology in the precise coding of the atomic bonds that distinguish between the different genetic self replicating structures possessed by different creatures that are thought to be branches of the same evolutionary tree.   And even the simplest single cell organism with a self replicating nucleus, having RNA & DNA, has a hopelessly complicated coding that can't possibly have originated by chance bombardment of the primordial soup with flashes of lightning.    The whole system of evolutionary thought makes no sense.  None of what we see in the living world could have come about by chance, no matter how many millions of years you have to work with.   You are laboring under a complete misunderstanding of the nature of Nature.  Nature has no agency.  It can't think.  It can't design.  It can't decide what to do.  It can't string together organic molecules into DNA with a meaningful sequence.  Only God could have done this.  To Him be the glory for creation.

@2MC  As for my name being applauded, no thanks.  As Wesley said in The Princess Bride, 'I am no one of consequence.'  What is important is for the name of the Lord to be praised, for Him to receive the glory for what He has made.

@danclark9977  If God planned, organized, and directed evolution, it didn't come about by chance. And yes, nature has no agency and can't think or design, but God can and, I believe, did.  Also, please explain this line to me, "vast distances at the level of molecular biology in the precise coding of the atomic bonds that distinguish between the different genetic self-replicating structures" Because that sounds like a bunch of scientific-sounding fluff.  Genetics very clearly shows that there can be genetic variation within a species. It's by these same genetic mechanisms that you can get genetic variation resulting in the evolution of a new species.   And yes, we don't have every "missing-link" fossil but we certainly have some. And the lack of those fossils is not evidence that the "missing-link" doesn't exist.

@2MC  Sir, these words are not my own.  As I said, I am no one of consequence.  My reference for the comment about the impossibility of random chance mutations causing atomic bonds to form organic molecules, and for these then to be strung together according to a precise code into amazing 3D structures within DNA that is necessary for even the simplest single cell that has a nucleus to be able to self replicate are from Michael Denton's book, 'Evolution:  A Theory in Crisis'.   The author of this book is an molecular biologist.  Also, please note, when you say, 'the lack of those fossils is not evidence that the 'missing-link' doesn't exist', you are using circular reasoning.  You are assuming that the missing link fossils exist, without scientifically observing them, because you believe that evolution happened.  But, real science is based on forming theories to explain what you have observed.

@2MC  Yes, genetics does show that there can be genetic variation within a species.  No argument there.  Scientists have been breeding fruit flies for I suppose thousands of generations, producing amazing variations.  But, there is a natural limit to the variations.  They are still fruit flies, after all.

@danclark9977  when Dmitri Mendeleev created his first version of our modern periodic table he left many blank spaces where he assumed their were undiscovered elements. He was confident there where missing elements based on all of his other observations. It is the same with evolution. All science and discovery so far says there where transition species and missing links. We have some but not all. That doesn't mean they don't exist, just like the undiscovered elements.  The long and the short of it is that I am not willing to out God in a box and say what he is and is not capable of. If you want to limit the Almighty's power and abilities you go ahead and do that.

@2MC  Thank you sir, I don't want to put God in a box, and His power and abilities are certainly limitless.  I believe that He spoke everything into existence in six 24 hour days, and that the beginning of everything that we are able to see and feel and touch came about only a few thousands of years ago, just like it says in Genesis.  There was no need for millions of years of uniformitarianism for things to start to happen, and that this is a perfectly reasonable thing to my way of thinking, precisely because His power is limitless.    As for missing links, I'm not sure which ones you have seen.  All I see when I look back are lots and lots of wonderful, fantastically beautiful creatures that used to roam the earth that have since gone extinct.  Lots of genetic diversity has been forever lost.  If evolution were true, I would expect to find just a few simple, pretty much boring life forms back then in the age of the fossils, and so many more life forms now, a broad profusion of diversity of newer, faster, smarter, bigger, better life forms today.  But no.  The life forms we have left are just midgets compared to what used to be jumping around.  I've heard of a fossil of the skull of a frog, found down in Texas, of such a size that the complete creature must have been six feet long!  Imagine what an incredible sound that thing would have made at night in the pond in your backyard!  If things continue as they have, in a few thousand more years, how many more species will have gone midget, and then extinct?  Probably all that will be left will be some miserable cockroaches.  All those incredible life forms, gone forever.  What a terrible shame.  I don't see any new branches on the evolutionary tree of life.  Just lots and lots of death, creeping up and taking over.  By the way, have you seen the book 'Undeniable' by Douglas Axe?  That's next on my list to read after I finish the Michael Denton book 'Evolution:  A Theory in Crisis'.    Have a good evening sir.  I hope to catch up with you later.  Thank you for hosting this site.

Two features having similar structure is somewhat of a hint towards homology, but that must then be proven somehow, usually through genetic research. Think of a penguin flipper and a shark fin, both look pretty similar, and do the same job, so one might think they are homologous. But when we look at their genetic history we see that penguin flippers and shark fins didn't come from a common ancestor, so they are not homologous, but analogous.

@ADultingisHarD91011  After reading the question over a few times, I can see that it is analogous, but also a very poorly written question.   It's analogous because the last common ancestor of all three groups was not multicellular, but unicellular. The question alludes to this by saying "the majority of..." but not all, because there all single-cell fungi for example. Therefore, multicellularity would be a similar function.   This question is poorly written because 1-the wording leads you to believe that the common ancestor was multicellular, and 2-It assumes you know whether the common ancestor was multicellular or single-celled, which you may or may not have discussed in class.   Hopefully that helps.

Homologous and analogous structures could be internal. However, in the case of humans and rates, their internal organs very similar with only slight differences. Homologous structures have a similar structure and common ancestor, but have differing functions. The internal organs of rats and humans have the same functions. Heart pumps blood, stomach digests, lungs facilitate oxygen transport, etc.   Rats and humans are both mammals, so they share some mammalian common ancestor that likely had many of the same or similar organs that functioned in similar ways.

Not sure if you're trolling or serious.  In the event that you are serious, the structure referred to is the anatomy or bone structure (in cases where there is a bone). The bone structure of a monkey arm (or maybe hand is more accurate) is very similar to the bone structure of a whale fin.  And yes, as you have stated the wings of a duck and an insect are similar in function, they are very different in their anatomical structure.   I hope that clears things up, let me know if you are still confused.

اليوم ستنتهي مع بقاء الشاشة فارغة. ما كان وراء المنعطف في الدفق غير معروف. كان كلاهما فضوليًا ، لكن واحدًا فقط كان شجاعًا بما يكفي ليريد الاستكشاف. كانت تلك هي المشكلة. كان هناك دائمًا شخص يدع الخوف يسيطر على حياتها. أحيانًا تكون أول لحظة في اليوم تفاجئك. هذا ما كان يفكر فيه ويندي. فتحت نافذتها لترى سيارات الإطفاء وهي تصرخ في الشارع. على الرغم من أن هذا لم يكن شيئًا غير مسموع به تمامًا ، إلا أنه لم يكن طبيعيًا أيضًا. لقد كانت علامة أكيدة على ما سيحدث في ذلك اليوم. كانت تشعر به في عظامها ولم تكن هذه هي الطريقة التي أرادت أن يبدأ بها اليوم. التقط الطرف المحترق من الفرع ووضع علامة على الحجر. اليوم 52 إذا كانت العلامات على الحجر دقيقة. لا يمكن أن يكون متأكدا. بدأ النهار والليالي يمتزجان معًا مما تسبب في حدوث ارتباك ، لكنه كان يعلم أن الوقت قد مضى وقتًا طويلاً. طويل جدا. لا يوجد سوى ثلاث طرق لجعل هذا العمل. الأول هو السماح لي بالاعتناء بكل شيء. والثاني هو أن تعتني بكل شيء. والثالث هو تقسيم كل شيء بنسبة 50/50. أعتقد أن الخيار الأخير هو الأفضل ، لكنني متأكد من أنه سيعني أيضًا نهاية زواجنا.لم تنساب الكلمات من أصابعه خلال الأسابيع القليلة الماضية. لم يتخيل أبدًا أنه سيجد نفسه مع كتلة الكاتب ، لكن هنا جلس أمامه شاشة فارغة. تلك الشاشة الفارغة التي كانت تسخر منه يومًا بعد يوم بدأت تلعب بعقله. لم يفهم لماذا لم يستطع حتى كتابة كلمة واحدة ، فقط واحدة لبدء العملية والبناء من هناك. ومع ذلك ، كان يعلم بالفعل أن الساعات الثماني التي كان مستعدًا للجلوس فيها أمام جهاز الكمبيوتر الخاص به اليوم ستنتهي مع بقاء الشاشة فارغة. ما كان وراء المنعطف في الدفق غير معروف. كان كلاهما فضوليًا ، لكن واحدًا فقط كان شجاعًا بما يكفي ليريد الاستكشاف. كانت تلك هي المشكلة. كان هناك دائمًا شخص يدع الخوف يسيطر على حياتها. أحيانًا تكون أول لحظة في اليوم تفاجئك. هذا ما كان يفكر فيه ويندي. فتحت نافذتها لترى سيارات الإطفاء وهي تصرخ في الشارع. على الرغم من أن هذا لم يكن شيئًا غير مسموع به تمامًا ، إلا أنه لم يكن طبيعيًا أيضًا. لقد كانت علامة أكيدة على ما سيحدث في ذلك اليوم. كانت تشعر به في عظامها ولم تكن هذه هي الطريقة التي أرادت أن يبدأ بها اليوم. التقط الطرف المحترق من الفرع ووضع علامة على الحجر.
